Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Gg-CATH7 (G. gangeticus cathelicidin 7, natural AMPs; crocodilian, reptiles, animals; UCLL1a)
Sequence Information.Source: fish-eating crocodile, the Indian gharial,Gavialis gangeticus, India/Nepal, Asia

Literature.Author: Santana FL, Estrada K, Alford MA, Wu BC, Dostert M, Pedraz L, Akhoundsadegh N, Kalsi P, Haney EF, Straus SK, Corzo G, Hancock REW. 2022
Literature.Title: Novel Alligator Cathelicidin As-CATH8 Demonstrates Anti-Infective Activity against Clinically Relevant and Crocodylian Bacterial Pathogens

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (75%) toAs-CATH7G=V: 15%; W=S=K=R=10%. GRAVY: -0.115; Mol Wt:2307.746; Mol formula:  C106H170N30O25S1; mol ex Coeff: 12590.Activity: Active against E. faecium (MIC>64 uM), S. aureus (MIC 16 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 4 uM), A. baumannii (MIC 1 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 8 uM), E. cloacae (MIC 2 uM), E. coli (MIC 4 uM), S. Typhimurium (MIC 4 uM), and P-vulgaris (MIC >64 uM). Also inhibit biofilm formation.Structure: helical in SDS or DPC micelles. Updated ref 5/2023
